dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.message: I'd try to act normal and blend in with the conversation, perhaps asking non-suspicious questions or sharing harmless information about myself to avoid arousing suspicion. For example, "Hey Bob, how was your day? Charlie

dialogue.speaker: Bob
dialogue.message: "Alice, I've noticed some inconsistencies in your story. I believe you're the assassin in our game. Let's vote on it now before Charlie becomes suspicious."

dialogue.speaker: Charlie
dialogue.message: I'd say, "Alice, your inconsistencies have piqued my interest. Can you please clarify those for me? Bob, what do you make of this?"

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.message: I'd respond to Charlie by expressing my confusion and asking for clarification on what inconsistencies Bob has noticed. I'd also try to assure both of them that I have no intention of harming them and am simply playing the game

dialogue.speaker: Bob
dialogue.message: "Alice, the inconsistencies in your story are clear to both Bob and me. Let's vote on it now before Charlie becomes more suspicious."

dialogue.speaker: Charlie
dialogue.message: "Alice, the inconsistencies in your story have been pointed out by Bob. Can you please explain these to clear up any confusion? Bob, do you stand by your accusation against Alice?"

dialogue.speaker: Alice
dialogue.message: I'd express my continued confusion over the alleged inconsistencies in my story and ask for clarification, while reiterating my commitment to playing the game honestly and not intending to harm Bob or Charlie.

dialogue.speaker: Bob
dialogue.message: "Alice, the inconsistencies in your story are not just noticeable to Bob and me, they are also becoming apparent to Charlie. Let's vote on it now to ensure the safety of our group."

dialogue.speaker: Charlie
dialogue.message: "Alice, the inconsistencies in your story have been brought to my attention by Bob. Can you please provide clarification to put everyone at ease? Bob, do you stand by your accusation against Alice?"
